title: Norway Manufacturing Production
description: Manufacturing Production in Norway increased 0.10 percent in September of 2022 over the same month in the previous year. Manufacturing Production in Norway averaged 0.94 percent from 1991 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 8.90 percent in May of 2007 and a record low of -10.40 percent in April of 2009. In Norway, manufacturing accounts for 27 percent of total production, mainly: food, beverages and tobacco (5 percent); refined petroleum, chemicals and pharmaceutical products (4 percent); machinery and equipment (3 percent); fabricated metal products (2 percent); ships, boats and oil platforms (2 percent); computer and electrical equipment (2 percent); repair, installation of machinery (2 percent); rubber, plastic and mineral products (2 percent); and basic metals (2 percent). This page provides - Norway Manufacturing Production - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Statistics Norway
